Re: License #: CB330201264
Dear MICHELLE ZALEWSKI:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
September 18, 2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS/Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The CA indicated the agency
was in compliance for the previous year's audit, therefore a Corrective Action Plan
was not required. The agency holds monthly supervisor quality team meetings to
review data and create solutions to address any barriers. The assessment noted
limited dental providers as well as delays with immigration attorneys on new
cases. In addition, recent staff resignations have created a staff shortage. The
Chief Administrator expressed confidence with continued compliance over the
upcoming review period.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
Staff Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via telephone. Staff reported feeling
supported by the agency. Supervisors and coworkers are available to assist as
needed. Staff did not report any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services; therefore this is not applicable.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
________________________________9/19/2024________
